task_prefix: A clinical dataset containing medical records of 299 heart failure patients collected at the Faisalabad Institute of Cardiology and at the Allied Hospital in Faisalabad (Punjab, Pakistan) during April-December 2015. The dataset is used to predict mortality by heart failure and includes 13 clinical features that are commonly collected during follow-up visits. Each example contains 13 features. Predict the platelets.

column_descriptions.age: Age of the patient at the time of data collection
column_descriptions.anaemia: Decrease of red blood cells or hemoglobin. Indicates if patient has anaemia
column_descriptions.creatinine_phosphokinase: Level of CPK enzyme in blood, indicating damage to heart muscle
column_descriptions.ejection_fraction: Percentage of blood leaving the heart at each contraction
column_descriptions.serum_creatinine: Level of serum creatinine in blood, indicating kidney function
column_descriptions.serum_sodium: Level of serum sodium in blood, indicating electrolyte balance
column_descriptions.death_event: If the patient died during the follow-up period

class_description: Target: platelets - Count of platelets in the blood, which are crucial for blood clotting and cardiovascular health. Units: kiloplatelets/mL. Range: 25,100 to 850,000
